ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.2_0: At that time a certain man said to his wife,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.3_0: “I’ll give a robe to Venerable Upananda.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.4_0: An alms-collecting monk heard that man making that statement.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.5_0: Then that monk went to Upananda,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.7_0: In such-and-such a place I heard a man telling his wife
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.8_0: that he’ll give you a robe.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.10_0: Just then Upananda went to that man,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.10_1: and after going, he said this to that man:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.11_0: “Is it true that you desire to give me a robe?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.13_0: that he’ll give you a robe.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.14_0: “If that’s the case, then give me such-and-such a robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.15_0: For what’s the point of giving a robe that I won’t use?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.16_0: The husband complained and criticized him,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.17_0: “These Sakyan ascetics have great desires; they are not content.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.18_0: It’s no easy matter to give them robe-cloth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.19_0: How can Venerable Upananda come to me and specify the kind of robe he wants without first being invited by me?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.20_0: The monks heard the complaints of that person,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.21_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.22_0: “How can Venerable Upananda approach a householder and specify the kind of robe he wants without first being invited?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.23_0: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Upananda:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.24_0: “Is it true, Upananda, that you acted like this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.28_0: “Foolish man, people who are not related don’t know what’s appropriate and what’s inappropriate in dealing with each other, what’s right and what’s wrong.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.29_0: And still you went to an unrelated householder and specified the kind of robe you wanted without first being invited.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.30_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.31_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.32.1_0: ‘If a male or female householder has set aside a robe fund for an unrelated monk, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.33_0: ‘With this robe fund I will buy a robe and give it to monk so-and-so;’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.34_0: If that monk approaches the kind of robe he wants without first being invited,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.35_0: ‘It would be good if you would use this robe fund to buy such-and-such a robe and then give it to me,’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.36_0: If it has been made, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.2_0: for the benefit of a monk; making a monk the object of consideration, one desires to give to him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.4_0: anyone who is not a descendant of one’s male ancestors going back seven generations, either on the mother’s side or on the father’s side.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.8_0: any woman who lives at home.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.10_0: money, gold, a pearl, a gem, a coral, a crystal, cloth, thread, or cotton wool.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.12_0: with that which is at one’s disposal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.16_0: I will give away the means.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.18_0: the monk for whom the robe fund has been set aside.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.20_0: he or she has not said beforehand: “Venerable, what kind of robe do you need? What kind of robe can I buy for you?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.22_0: having gone to their house or having gone wherever.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.23_0: Specifies the kind of robe he wants:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.24_0: please make it long or wide or closely woven or soft.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.26_0: with that which is at one’s disposal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.28_0: long or wide or closely woven or soft.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.34_0: wanting something nice, wanting something expensive.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.35_0: If that lay person buys a robe that is long, wide, closely woven, or soft because of the monk’s statement, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.36_0: When he gets the robe-cloth, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.37_0: The blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.38_0: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.40_0: ‘Venerables, this robe which I received after approaching an unrelated householder and specifying the kind of robe I wanted without first being invited is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.41_0: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.44_0: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.2.1_0: If the householder is unrelated and the monk perceives them as such, and, without first being invited, he approaches them and specifies the kind of robe he wants, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.2.2_0: If the householder is unrelated, but the monk is unsure of it, and, without first being invited, he approaches them and specifies the kind of robe he wants, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.2.3_0: If the householders are unrelated, but he perceives them as related, and, without first being invited, he approaches them and specifies the kind of robe he wants, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.2.4_0: If the person is related, but the monk perceives them as unrelated, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.2.5_0: If the person is related, but the monk is unsure of it, commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.2.6_0: If the person is related and the monk perceives them as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.3.4_0: if it is built for someone else;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.3.5_0: if it is by means of her own property;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.3.6_0: if the lay person wishes to buy something expensive, but the monk gets them to buy something inexpensive;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.3.8_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.3.9_0: The eighth rule, the training rule on what is set aside, is finished.
